bug.author: Vivraan
bug.summary: com.unity.ml-agents package missing in latest_release branch
bug.description:
Describe the bug After providing the file link in UnitySDK/Packages/manifest.json, the editor spits an error saying that it doesn't recognise the package. To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Clone the repo as shown in the Installation guide. Observe that no directory called com.unity.ml-agents exist. Try cloning the master/checking out to master. Observe that the directory exists, and once provided in the manifest.json file, the ML-Agents package is detected succesfully.
Console logs / stack traces <denchmark-code> Project has invalid dependencies: com.unity.ml-agents: The file [C:\dev\UnityProjects\ml-agents\com.unity.ml-agents\package.json] cannot be found
A re-import of the project may be required to fix the issue or a manual modification of C:/dev/UnityProjects/ml-agents/UnitySDK/Packages/manifest.json file. </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12777564/73391823-b5f3c680-42fe-11ea-8e33-9e53cb9d56cc.png></denchmark-link>
Environment (please complete the following information):
OS + version: Windows 10, 1903 ML-Agents version: 0.13.1 TensorFlow version: 2.0.1 Environment: any among the given examples

comments.comment: Hi @ShivamMukherjee, please follow <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Unity-Technologies/ml-agents/blob/latest_release/docs/Installation.md>the instructions from the latest release</denchmark-link> . The master branch is the branch we actively develop in. The instructions for installation on the master branch will be updated over the next couple of days. Thank you.

I will close this issue for now. If you run into other installation issues, please post to the <denchmark-link:https://forum.unity.com/forums/ml-agents.453/>Unity ML-Agents Forum</denchmark-link> . Cheers.
